messages.message: Any word on when we might be able to turn these back on?

According to this thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01N7DV1137/p1723754088054259?thread_ts=1723658240.438109&cid=C01N7DV1137), we’re close to restoring the crafting-cyp cluster. I’ll do some testing before re-enabling. Hopefully we can enable by EOD today
ah i was just going to start running some tests - are you already in the middle of doing so? do you need any help? @Paul H

I haven’t done much on my end. I simply made a PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/10410944054/job/28834102513?pr=61481) that reverted the change to see how the tests are going. Seems like there’s errors :cry: will investigate when the tests finish.

> • `apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/BuildApp/aihub-quick-clean-refinement.spec.ts`
> • `apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/BuildApp/aihub-classification.spec.ts`
> • `apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/BuildApp/aihub-redigitization.spec.ts`
> • `apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/ViewApp/run-public-app.spec.ts`
all the failed tests ^ are failing for the same reason
`Account cypress-user-61481_instabase.com (http://cypress-user-61481_instabase.com) is not integrated with metronome`

but most tests are passing!

Yeah, I’m seeing the same error. I wonder if this is a case where the account creation failed somewhere or if our setup is wrong somewhere. @Xindi Xu do you know off the top of your head? It’s from this endpoint `GET /api/v2/licenses/billing-plans/history?limit=5`

@Victor Zeng - do you know why newly created community users have license checks failed with `Account cypress-user-61481_instabase.com (http://cypress-user-61481_instabase.com) is not integrated with metronome`? The script calls `POST /api/v2/licenses/trial-license/ai-hub` to create the license. `ENABLE_COMMUNITY_METRONOME` is at ib opt in stage now
tracing back in git. Maybe it's related to this change? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/60869
We do have the check for `if metronome_customer_id != None:` before doing the metronome stuff in the `trial-license` endpoint.
`GET /api/v2/licenses/billing-plans/history?limit=5` should only be called when the feature flag is set since it's a metronome endpoint.
@Weiming Wu Are we missing a feature flag check somewhere in the frontend?

Ah, yep, there should be a feature flag check in `PlanExpiredModal/index.tsx`
I'll bring it up for review
Whoa, does this mean a bug snuck in in the short time Cypress was disabled?!
I'm not sure that this would have caused a Cypress test failure, but potentially, yes :sweat_smile:

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/61500
It's up (a simple one-liner)! I'm clocking out for today so if it's super crucial, any of you can merge it in for me
